comment:
Nose is great. Dried fruit, light smoke.
Palate: some dried fruit, spiky notes from the younger malt.
Finish: short and uneventful.
Was not crazy about this one bit.

Tasting poured neat from 750ml at ABC store, small plastic taster.  Spice and berries, with some grape must coming on.  Decent and interesting, but I must admit I am not a lover of port-finished whisky, so a sample is enough for me.   7/20/19
Fruity with a bit of spice, bite grew the longer the pour was out
Fruity cherry/raisin nose with a slight burn and cereal aftertaste. I enjoy this one.
Bright but light sweet flavor. Smooth and minimal burn. Strong after taste.
Spicy. Has a bite to it that sticks with you. Good for a cold winter night. A bit young but the port finish evens it out.
Bday present from the wife. Finally got around to having it. Good

Starts with a port and charred barrel nose. First sip of this is quite smokey. You might even think you were drinking scotch execpt there is an over ripe berry and grape fullness to it. Gives way to a peppery burn that is quite long lasting, but lacks any strong flavors.
Heavy on the cereal and barley notes. Ever so slight fruit at the very end.
Perfect flavor profile and smooth as silk on the finish.
The port cask aging adds a fruity, sweetness to the whiskey blend.
Sweet on the nose, elegant mouthfeel. Sweet, but of spice and smokiness, full-bodied, warming and long finish.

VA Distilling Co. Port Cask (Batch 12)
Pours into the Glencairn a dark reddish gold.
Nose: Port. Dark Dried Fruits like Raisin and Prune. A Soapy/Perfumey Floral Note. Tea, Old Oak and an occasional hint of Lemon Peel. It also has a heavy "Boozy" quality if that makes sense?
Neat: Heavy Mouthfeel. Barrel Notes, Port, Leather, Tea, and a wisp of Smoke. Slightly warming dry finish with Black Pepper and Earthy Oak coating the tongue. You get some accumulating heat on the back of the throat and a Slightly Tannic/Musty Leather aftertaste lingers.
Splash: A little water gives the nose and palate some Extra Spice and a good dose of Vanilla.
Verdict: This was the second sample out of my (3) 375ml pack. I like this one almost as much as I liked the Cider Cask Finish. Being born in the mountains of Southwest VA, I knew I'd be predisposed to liking these, but I've been surprised by how good they actually are. Hope to try the Chardonnay Finish tonight. Another 4 Star.

Nose: Floral, very Winey.
Palate: hot. Probably should have added water. Cherry. Sweet. Wood.
Finish: lingers, spice
Smooth and fruity, but lacks depth of flavor
A bit of a funk on the palate for me. I’ll try another bottle just to be sure. This bottle was a 2-star for me.
A little young but good flavor. Their other whiskies are tasty too. Sweet. Spicy.
Great stuff. Smooth with notes of red berries, chocolate, joined by malty cereal and barrel spices on the palate

Nose: Brandied cherries, nougat candy, oak, and cinnamon.

Palate: Rich nougat, tart cherry, tobacco, light notes of cocoa, rather thin mouthfeel.

Finish: Very dry, slow, and not especially intense burn.
Heavier than just an after taste of smoke.

Nose is malty slightly bright sweetness with dark stone fruit and maybe a bit of dark chocolate. Taste is some almost burnt toast maltyness with Black cherry or plum, a bit of spice at the end that lingers
Port cask finish adds a sweet, stone-fruit note to the malt whiskey base.  Really enjoyable sipping dram.
Scotch whiskey, a bit of a bite, but good
The berry-ness of the port adds a sweetness to augment the grain sweetness. A great taste overall.

Color: Orange gold

Nose: Almonds, nutty, cherry, toffee, cocoa, oak, and plums.

Palate: Coffee, vanilla, oily, peppery, and toasted nuts.

Finish: Medium in length, leather, cinnamon spice, licorice, and oak.
